text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Jobs growth, particularly in 1998 to rise faster than earlier estimated, government policy unit CPB says. (p1)
- Start-up losses at commercial TV broadcaster SBS6 since August 1995 launch rise to 63 million guilders. (p5)
- Cable-makers Draka of Amsterdam and Twentsche Kabel sell cross-shareholdings. (p1,13)
- Getronics buys 65 percent of Amsterdam-based consultancy Business Management Group. (p3)
- ING Groep NV unit Postbank wants all applicants for shares in over-subscribed bourse flotations to receive the same number of shares. (p2)
- Ahold's Dutch supermarkets chain Albert Heijn expands lower-price Euro Shopper product range by 50 percent as price war escalates. (p17).
- Dutch metal employers body says members may move production abroad if shortage of lower and middle-skilled staff persists. (p25)
- Dutch port workers employment pool SHB withdraws plans to sack 200 people and cut working hours for another 330 and will discuss alternatives with unions. (p12)
